intro: Columnea rubriacuta, commonly known as the red-sharp columnea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Columnea rubriacuta thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
